name: 3,3,3-trifluoro-N-(1-methylpropyl)-2-(trifluoromethyl)propanamide
source: Karthikeyan M.; Glen R.C.; Bender A. General melting point prediction based on a diverse compound dataset and artificial neural networks. J. Chem. Inf. Model.; 2005; 45(3); 581-3479
Reason: 3,3,3-trifluoro-N-(1-methylpropyl)-2-(trifluoromethyl)propanamide has a complex structure with multiple functional groups that impact its melting point. The basic unit for comparison is propane, which has a melting point of -18.7 °C (according to the CRC Handbook of Chemistry and Physics, 49th Edition, 1968-1969). The trifluoromethyl group (–CF3) adds approximately +10 °C due to increased molecular weight and rigidity. The methyl group (–CH2CH3) introduces a small increase of approximately +5 °C due to additional molecular weight and possible hydrogen bonding. The fluorine atoms (–F) contribute to the melting point due to increased molecular weight and rigidity, estimated at approximately +10 °C each. The nitrogen atom (–N) can participate in hydrogen bonding, which may raise the melting point by approximately +5 °C. The carbamate group (–CO–NH–) introduces a significant increase due to the formation of hydrogen bonds, estimated at approximately +20 °C. The trifluoromethyl group (–CF3) also raises the melting point due to increased molecular weight and rigidity, estimated at approximately +10 °C.
